common: Pregnancy category: D; tobacco smoke known to cause low birth weight, spontaneous abortion, increased perinatal mortality, decreased placental perfusion; however, nicotine replacement is believed to be safer during pregnancy than smoking

Lactation: Nicotine and metabolite (cotinine) pass into breast milk up to hr after maternal smoking; risk of exposure of infant to 2nd hand smoke may be more detrimental than nicotine replacement; nicotine may increase infant heart rate
Pregnant or breastfeeding patients should seek advice of health professional before using OTC drugs
